thread.title: Trump’s Infrastructure Plan Counts on States to Do Heavy Lifting

author: Gerald F. Seib
title: Trump’s Infrastructure Plan Counts on States to Do Heavy Lifting
text:
The Trump administration’s new initiative to improve the nation’s infrastructure represents a gamble that a small monetary nudge and a smoother regulatory path will be enough to spur cities and states to do big things.

In the plan to be announced Monday, the White House will ask Congress to dedicate $200 billion over the next decade to improvements for roads, bridges, airports, water projects and digital networks. It is counting on that investment as seed money to spur $1.5 trillion in overall infrastructure spending nationally... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
